info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 6:48AM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Elkhart, St. Joseph, northeastern Marshall, southern Cass and southeastern Berrien Counties through 745 AM EDT... At 647 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Niles to North Liberty. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... South Bend, Elkhart, Mishawaka, Goshen, Niles, Nappanee, Bremen, Buchanan, Georgetown, Gulivoire Park, Simonton Lake, Granger, Dunlap, Osceola, Berrien Springs, Cassopolis, Wakarusa, Bristol, Edwardsburg and Lakeville. This includes Interstate 80 in Indiana between mile markers 69 and 99. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
